Description: Bronze mirror; slightly oval metal disc with floral volutes on either side of handle (now lost along with lower part of disc); surface very corroded and encrusted.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: See: J.-M. Chavane, La nécropole d'Amathonte. Tombs 113-367. IV. Les petits objets (Nicosia 1990), pp 14-15 for Hellenistic and Roman mirrors from Amathus. Also SCE IV/2, fig. 25.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 85, Tomb 112 no. 1)
